result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF377 and 14CF559 called: 11:03am
State appears by ADA K.Puig.  Def appears in person and with Atty David Casey.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable

COURT receives amended information as filed in 14CF377 as no objection by Atty Casey; W/R

State moves to:
14CF377 - Cts. 1, 4, and 5>>D&RI
14CF559>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
14CF377 - Ct. 2 (Poss Para/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
14CF377 - Ct. 3 (Poss Para/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
14CF377 - Ct. 6 (Poss Para/Repeater/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all 3 counts; 2 years probation on each count concurrent
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; Absolute sobriety; CC.

(originally set for plea)

Parties state agreement has been reached in MC cases, but pending case from Lincoln County is still contemplated to be consolidated with these cases; Atty Casey notes difficulty in reaching DA in Lincoln County and only spoke w/them last Friday.
COURT questions parties re: consolidation - Atty Casey has drafted all paperwork however details of agreement have not been reached as to disposition.
STC on Lincoln Co case on 12/19 and Atty Casey will be in contact with defendant's counsel in Lincoln Co case.

No contact with victim(s): R.B.
Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
No use/possession of controlled substances unless prescribed to him and then only if prescribed.
